required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Internal Carotid Artery Blood Flow in Robot-Assisted Laparoscopic Prostatectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Change of Internal Carotid Artery Blood Flow During Pneumoperitoneum With Steep Trendelenburg Position in Robot-Assisted Laparoscopic Prostatectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the change of the internal carotid artery blood flow according to the steep trendelenburg position and pneumoperitoneum in patients undergoing robot-assisted laparoscopic prostatectomy.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in internal carotid artery blood flow
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 10 minutes after pneumoperitoneum with steep Trendelenburg position
primary_outcome.description: Difference between the internal carotid artery blood flow measured at 10 minutes after anesthetic induction during supine position and the internal carotid artery blood flow measured at 10 minutes after pneumoperitoneum with steep Trendelenburg position

secondary_outcome.description: Internal carotid artery blood flow before anesthetic induction
Internal carotid artery blood flow at 10 minutes after anesthetic induction

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 10 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position
secondary_outcome.description: Internal carotid artery blood flow at 10 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 30 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position
secondary_outcome.description: Internal carotid artery blood flow at 30 minutes after pneumoperitoneum and Trendelenburg position
Internal carotid artery blood flow during supine position at skin closure

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have undergone robot-assisted laparoscopic prostatectomy with prostate cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have undergone robot-assisted laparoscopic prostatectomy with prostate cancer and who are 20 years or older and under 80 years
- Patients who agree to voluntarily participate in this study
- Patients with ASA class 1-2
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of diagnosis of cerebrovascular disease
- Patients who refused to participate in clinical studies
